content.raw:
Playing around with this on mac showed no bugs.

It might be personal taste but I think scrolling shouldn't happen with a fixed distance but rather in a away that the left most tab always sits flush with the bounding line \(if possible\). This way one would not have to click left/right multiple times to fully move a tab with long tab name out of and a new one into view. 

Also there was some odd behavior for small window sizes that I noticed. \(This doesn't really need fixing\):

1. If a tab is moved to a new line even if it is long enough the scroll buttons appear:  
  ![test.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/xg9BdE/images/2889053505-test.gif 'test.gif')
2. If in you move a tab inside a line the scroll buttons sometimes randomly appear and disappear:  
  ![test2.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/xg9BdE/images/4059912907-test2.gif 'test2.gif')
